events.title: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria
events.description: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie were assassinated in Sarajevo by Gavrilo Princip, an event that directly triggered the outbreak of World War I.
events.significance: This assassination set off a chain reaction of alliances and conflicts that led to the start of World War I, drastically altering global history.

events.title: Signing of the Treaty of Versailles
events.description: The Treaty of Versailles was signed, officially ending World War I. The treaty imposed heavy reparations and territorial losses on Germany.
events.significance: The harsh terms of the treaty contributed to economic hardship and political instability in Germany, ultimately influencing the rise of Nazism and leading to World War II.

events.title: The first legal same-sex marriages in Canada
events.description: Canada became the fourth country to legalize same-sex marriage nationwide, following a Supreme Court ruling that mandated the government to change laws.
events.significance: This was a landmark moment for LGBTQ+ rights and equality, reflecting significant progress on social acceptance and legal recognition of same-sex relationships.

events.title: Start of the Battle of the Somme
events.description: The Battle of the Somme began during World War I with British and French forces launching a massive offensive against German positions along the River Somme in France.
events.significance: One of the bloodiest battles in human history, it highlighted the brutal nature of trench warfare and had lasting effects on military tactics and public perception of the war.
